intro: Antholyza bicolor, commonly known as the two-colored antholyza, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and umbellate inflorescences. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters and prefers well-drained soils in full sun. Its flowers, which range in color from white to pale yellow, bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Antholyza bicolor is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional herbal medicine.
